name: Artificial Intelligence for Medicine
long_desc: This course introduces Artificial Intelligence AI and its recent applications in medicine for students with no background in computer science. It starts by motivating and defining AI, before folding over to a survey of some of its newest applications to medicine, including diagnosis, prognosis, drug discovery, and recommendations of individualized treatments, to mention just a few. Afterwards, it provides a birdseye view of some of the major AI techniques, including machine learning, deep neural networks, recommendation systems, ranked retrieval, and probabilistic graphical models. Finally, it concludes with a discussion on some of the concerns related to AI, including ethical issues, job security, society, and healthcare institutions, among others

custom_fields.goals: The course incorporates six major learning outcomes. In particular, after finishing the course, each student will be able toa.Define AI and discuss what AI can and cannot do, especially with respect to the medical field.b.Identify various AI applications in medicine and explain how they are transforming healthcare.c.Recognize the power of big data in enabling AI and describe different types of data representations.d.Recognize the power of algorithmic thinking and discuss conceptually how algorithms can learn from medical data.e.Differentiate between various AI concepts, including machine learning, deep learning, and probabilistic graphical models, among others.f.Discuss several societal issues and ethical concerns surrounding AI

custom_fields.assessment_structure:
Each student will receive a numeric score with a corresponding letter grade, based on a weighted average of the following:


a.	Problem Sets: There will be 4 homework assignments, which will account for 40% of the final score.

b.	Quiz: There will be 2 quizzes, which will account for 20% of the final score.

c.	Exam: There will be two exams, midterm and final, which will account for 15% and 20%, respectively (or 35% collectively) of the final score.

d.	Class Participation and Attendance: Attendance of classes and participation in discussions will account for 5% of the final score.
custom_fields.relevance: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is transforming various sectors, including medicine. This course will teach students what is AI, take them through a journey of AI applications in medicine, and give them a practical experience in applying AI to solve real-world problems. It will demystify major AI concepts for them, including machine learning, neural networks, Bayesian networks, recommendation systems, data science, and ranked retrieval, among others. In addition, it will allow them to navigate several societal issues and ethical concerns that surround AI.
custom_fields.learning_resources: There is no specific textbook for the course, but certain notes and papers will be assigned for reading. In addition, the slides provided by the instructor will be self-contained. All course material will be posted on the course webpage.
